hospital.model

Class WaitingRoom

  • java.lang.Object
    • hospital.model.WaitingRoom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WaitingRoom
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class abstracts details of an ER waiting room consisting of a list of Patients. WaitingRoom objects provide an urgency-ordered view of the Patients consistent with medical triage principles. More urgent patients will be placed in the list ahead of less urgent patients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WaitingRoom()
      Builds a new empty waiting room with no Patients.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPatient(Patient sickPerson)
      Adds a specified Patient to the waiting room while preserving the urgency-ordering of Patients based on the triage rules described by Patient.compareTo.
      Patient getNextPatient()
      Retrieves the next most-urgent person from the WaitingRoom.
      int getNumWaiting()
      Retrieves the current total number of patients waiting in the WaitingRoom.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Produces a String containing details about the current status of this WaitingRoom.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaitingRoom

        public WaitingRoom()
        Builds a new empty waiting room with no Patients.

    • Method Detail

      • addPatient

        public void addPatient(Patient sickPerson)
        Adds a specified Patient to the waiting room while preserving the urgency-ordering of Patients based on the triage rules described by Patient.compareTo.
        Parameters:
        sickPerson - The newly arrived Patient to place in this WaitingRoom.

      • getNextPatient

        public Patient getNextPatient()
        Retrieves the next most-urgent person from the WaitingRoom. This method also removes the Patient from the WaitingRoom as they are now being seen by a physician.
        Returns:
        The most-urgent Patient object that was in the WaitingRoom.
        Throws:
        EmptyWaitingRoomException - when there are no patients waiting to be seen.

      • getNumWaiting

        public int getNumWaiting()
        Retrieves the current total number of patients waiting in the WaitingRoom.
        Returns:
        The number of patients waiting.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Produces a String containing details about the current status of this WaitingRoom. Data is formatted as shown below. Fields to be replaced with actual values are shown in [VALUE] notation.

        When no patients are waiting 

         Waiting Room Status: EMPTY!

        When one or more patients are waiting 

         Waiting Room Status: 
 [  #]) [FIRST PATIENT INFORMATION]
 [  #]) [SECOND PATIENT INFOMRATION]

        Waiting room positions should be displayed in a 5 character wide, right aligned field followed by a right parenthesis and a single space character. Patient information is then presented per the toString format described in the Patient class. For example: 

        Waiting Room Status: 
    1) Patient: Levy, Thomasine           Condition: Asthma                    Priority: 3   Waiting Since: 5
    2) Patient: Figueroa, Francesco       Condition: High Fever                Priority: 3   Waiting Since: 8
    3) Patient: Rakes, Raye               Condition: Minor Allergic Reaction   Priority: 3   Waiting Since: 9
    4) Patient: Noles, Oliver             Condition: Low-grade Fever           Priority: 4   Waiting Since: 4

        When one or more patients are shown in the status, the patient listed as #1 corresponds to the Patient that would be served next (assuming no additional Patients were added subsequently).

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
